intro: Anthocleista frezoulsii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruits are follicles that split open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, wooded areas. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
